alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin; Lower Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 10 at 3:51PM MDT until May 10 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: .Potential for rain on snow event may lead to accelerated snowmelt and a period of high runoff. Quickly rising rivers may reach critical levels by Thursday evening, with high water possible through the weekend. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Colorado along the central and lower Yampa River Basins. * WHEN...From Friday evening through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - High runoff potential from rain on snow accelerating snowmelt. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Central Yampa River Basin; Lower Yampa River Basin
